title: 112_hr5835
content:
The "Veterans Access to Capital Act of 2012" may be cited as the short title. It establishes a loan program for veterans for certain projects. Section 502 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to include a loan program for veterans, allowing the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to make loans to small business concerns owned and controlled by veterans. Loans are limited to 20 percent of available amounts each fiscal year and must adhere to specific terms and conditions. Loans under this subsection are limited to specific amounts based on the purpose of the project, with a maximum of $5,500,000 for small manufacturers. The loan proceeds must be used for projects approved by the Administration. The Small Business Administration provides loans up to $5,500,000 for small manufacturers for projects that reduce energy consumption by 10% or generate renewable energy/fuels. The small business must contribute at least 15% of the project cost. The Small Business Administration requires small manufacturers to contribute a minimum percentage of the total project cost based on specific conditions, with collateralization following certain requirements. The Small Business Administration mandates that small manufacturers must meet specific requirements, including compliance with subsection (a)(3)(E) and additional requirements outlined in paragraphs (4), (5), (6), and (7) of subsection (a). The term "small manufacturer" is defined as a small business concern in this context. A small manufacturer is a small business concern primarily in sectors 31, 32, or 33 of the NAICS, with all production facilities in the US. SEC. 3. A loan program for veterans is established under the Small Business Act, allowing the Administrator to make loans to small business concerns owned and controlled by veterans. Not more than 20 percent of loans made in a fiscal year may be under this program. Loans can only be made directly by the Administrator to the small business concern.

SEC. 4. Veteran credit score relief is introduced under the Small Business Act, providing assistance to veterans with their credit scores. "Veteran credit score relief is provided for small business loans under the Small Business Act, reducing credit score requirements for veterans and service-disabled veterans who comply with specified conditions." "Veteran credit score relief is granted for small business loans under the Small Business Act, reducing credit score requirements for veterans and service-disabled veterans who meet specified conditions, with exceptions for violations of the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act."
